c55d1612-e072-44f6-b11f-3500ed35ffeb.1c251e10-8d0e-4ed7-8894-fe63efa5e27a.callout=Performs a Linux Health Check and returns  information about the system.
c55d1612-e072-44f6-b11f-3500ed35ffeb.3a1a1ae9-3cb9-4aaa-b844-3ee572f5b295.description=
This operation will log if level>\=logLevel (latter is set by initialise). If level
c55d1612-e072-44f6-b11f-3500ed35ffeb.3c89313a-f0c8-434d-8681-ed1bf312ad39.prompt=Enter a value for logLocation
c55d1612-e072-44f6-b11f-3500ed35ffeb.5d1c46b7-7ce6-4c42-b3cb-7e109e9f7c69.description=
 This flow performs a Linux health check by pinging the system and then running several commands and collecting information regarding the operating system, CPUs, disks, networks, memory and processes.

Inputs\:
    host - The hostname or IP address of the system to shutdown/restart.
    username - The user to connect to the host.
    password - The password to connect to the host.
    diskName - The disk name (Device) to check.
Default value\: /dev/sda
    networkName - The name of the network interface to check.
Default value\: lo

Responses\:
    success - Server health check completed.
    failure - An error occurred when pinging the server, the health check could not be performed.

Results\:
    averageReadsPerSec - The average number of read requests that were issued to the device per second.
    averageWritesPerSec - The average number of write requests that were issued to the device per second.
    cpuMetrics - The result of the vmstat command.
    diskMetrics - The disk metrics for the system.
    diskUsage - Percentage of the disk used.
    extendedIO - The iostat return data.
    freeMemory - The number of megabytes of unused memory.
    fsList - A table of file system names and percentage usage sorted with the most full system first.
    loadAverage - The one minute load average.
    memoryMetrics - Detailed information regarding the memory.
    networkInterfaces - The result of the check for network errors on the system.
    networkMetrics - The netstat return string.
    osName - The OS name (uname return information).
    osType - The OS type ( linux ).
    osVersion - The version of the operating system.
    processList - The process list using the long output format.
    processesSleeping - The number of sleeping processes.
    processesWaitingForRuntime - The number of process waiting for runtime.
    processorCount - The number of processors.
    totalMemory - The number of megabytes of total memory.
    uptime - The number of minutes the system has been up.
    used - The number of MB of the disk used.
    usedMemory - The number of megabytes of used memory.

c55d1612-e072-44f6-b11f-3500ed35ffeb.7fb3c09e-8f71-4f4e-9810-e3fc9e71ace6.description=
 This operation generates a HTML report that contains information collected during the Operating Systems health check run.

Inputs\:
    reportLocation - Absolute path to the location where the report will be generated.
Example\: C\:\reports\executionReport.html
    osType - The type of operating system.
Valid values\: windows, linux
Default value\: windows
    osName - Operating system kernel name. Applies for both windows and linux.
    osVersion - Operating system version. Applies for linux only.
    processorCount - Number of processors on the system. Applies for both windows and linux.
    uptime - Number of minutes the system has been up. Applies for both windows and linux.
    freeMemory - Number of megabytes of unused memory. Applies for both windows and linux.
    usedMemory - Number of megabytes of used memory. Applies for linux only.
    totalMemory - Number of megabytes of total memory. Applies for linux only.
    used - Number of MB of the disk used. Applies for linux only.
    diskUsage - Percentage of the disk used. Applies for linux only. Applies for linux only.
    averageReadsPerSec - Average number of write requests that were issued to the device per second. Applies for linux only.
    averageWritesPerSec - Average number of read requests that were issued to the device per second. Applies for linux only.
    processesSleeping - Number of sleeping processes. Applies for linux only.
    processesWaitingForRuntime - Number of process waiting for runtime. Applies for linux only.
    extendedIO - Extended information from iostat using iostat -x. Applies for linux only.
    fsList - Detailed information regarding the file system. Applies for both windows and linux.
    cpuMetrics - Detailed metrics for the CPU. Applies for linux only.
    networkMetrics - Detailed information for a network Interface. Applies for linux only.
    processList - Detailed list of processes. Applies for both windows and linux.
    memoryMetrics - Detailed metrics for the memory. Applies for linux only.

Responses\:
    success - The report was generated successfully.
    failure - An error occurred when generating the actual report, or the location given as input was incorrect.      


c55d1612-e072-44f6-b11f-3500ed35ffeb.93a077a1-f825-412a-8a56-394196bd9f02.description=
This operation will log if level>\=logLevel (latter is set by initialise). If level
c55d1612-e072-44f6-b11f-3500ed35ffeb.9c59d5f3-a2fb-4402-a59f-2be353660574.callout=Detects the operating system. If no host is specified, it will run on lacalhost.
c55d1612-e072-44f6-b11f-3500ed35ffeb.aa1f84cf-cf6b-4a1d-aa4a-5f85d8f7881e.callout=Checks whether the logging is enabled or not. By default, logging is disabled.
c55d1612-e072-44f6-b11f-3500ed35ffeb.c26c43c2-b4e7-4334-a4c2-102e6a0c9985.description=
This operation will log if level>\=logLevel (latter is set by initialise). If level
c55d1612-e072-44f6-b11f-3500ed35ffeb.c5fb64c7-ee40-4441-addb-26b62d1ec16e.callout=This flow performs an agnostic operating system health check on a Linux or Windows host.
Depending on the type of operating system detected ( Windows or Linux based ) the flow performs a health check on the host by running specific commands. 
The information retrieved includes memory, CPU, disk, processor and network metrics.
All the information is included in a report.
The flow also provides a logging mechanism.

c55d1612-e072-44f6-b11f-3500ed35ffeb.d9ca3348-6d49-4271-9fae-f108efc364f8.description=
This operation will set up the log4j environment to be used by the OO flow. 
It is assumed that this operation is one of the first steps and that it is only called ONCE  in the entire flow+subflows.

Inputs\:
logLocation      This op runs on the default worker group, in a cluster/ha environment it is recommended to put the log file on a file share. Note, this input must end with / or \ (linux/windows).
logLevel	Same options as known from log4j\: TRACE, DEBUG, INFO, WARN, ERROR, FATAL
overwrite	default false, but if true the file will be cleared by this operation
pattern	default value\: %d{yyyy-MM-dd HH\:mm\:ss,SSS} %-5p - %m%n - Check the PatternLayout class here\: http\://logging.apache.org/log4j/1.2/apidocs/index.html
logType	default value\: FILE. Currently the only supported value. We intend to add MEMORY and MEMORY+FILE later on.

Note that you can still have log operation with say DEBUG level, but if the main log level is set to INFO, nothing will happen and the log operation will still report success (important\: this operation is not the one that logs - this is only to initialize the logger).

Responses\:
success
failure - invalid inputs


c55d1612-e072-44f6-b11f-3500ed35ffeb.dba6082c-7eb5-45f0-942b-75d8799c0cd6.description=
This operation will log if level>\=logLevel (latter is set by initialise). If level
c55d1612-e072-44f6-b11f-3500ed35ffeb.dc63f2bf-faaf-4bce-86cc-62ab6774e5e3.description=
Compares two strings, returning a true response if and only if they contain the same sequence of characters. A null string is considered to be equal to an empty string.

Inputs\:
string1 - The first string.
string2 - The second string.
ignoreCase - If set to 'true', then the comparison ignores case considerations. The two strings are considered equal ignoring case if they are of the same length and corresponding characters in the two strings are equal ignoring case. If set to any value other than 'true', then the strings must match exactly to be considered equal.

responses\:
true - If the two strings are equal
false - If the two strings are not equal



c55d1612-e072-44f6-b11f-3500ed35ffeb.dce4b389-294d-4d03-baf8-4efed75102b5.callout=Initializes the log file.
c55d1612-e072-44f6-b11f-3500ed35ffeb.description=
This flow detects the operating system of a given host, performs a health check on the host and creates a report with information retrieved by the health check. If a host is not supplied, it will run on localhost.

If enableLogging is true, the log file created with the logging mechanism is created on localhost, if the flow is run locally, or on the corresponding ras if the flow is executed remotely.

Inputs\:
    host - The hostname or IP address of the system to perform the health check on.
    username - The user to connect to the host.
    password - The password to connect to the host.
    reportLocation - The absolute path for the report. The generated report is an html file. If the flow fails the report will not be generated.
Example\: C\:\reports\executionReport.html
    diskName - The disk name (Device) to check, for the linux version. For windows machines this input will be ignored.
Default value\: /dev/sda
    enableLogging - The option to create a log file with information about the execution of the flow. By default logging is disabled. If this option is set to true but the initialization of the log fails, then logging will be disabled.
Valid values\: true, false
Default value\: false
    logLocation - The absolute path where the log file will be created/updated. This is a required input if 'enableLogging' is true. If you don't supply it, you will be prompted. If the directory supplied does not exist, it will be created.
Example\: C\:\execution.log
    loggingLevel - The level of detail information will be present in the log file. If TRACE is used, then no error messages will be logged. This input is case sensitive.
Valid values\: TRACE, DEBUG, INFO, WARN, ERROR, FATAL.
Default value\: DEBUG.

Responses\:
    success - The health check completed successfully.
    failure - An error occurred during the detection of the operating system of the specified host or during the health check of that host.

Results\:
    osName - This is the primary output. This result contains the result of the detection of the operating system for the specified host.
    exception - This result contains information about the cause of the failure.


c55d1612-e072-44f6-b11f-3500ed35ffeb.e093050f-9f02-4ef4-ba7a-9c06fd61f4fe.callout=Performs a Windows Health Check and returns information about the system.
c55d1612-e072-44f6-b11f-3500ed35ffeb.f73a2160-7fb3-4c22-bc42-5e3c016b9a02.description=
Adds a flow variable into the local context (available to itself and child flows only)

Input Parameters\:
keyName - the name of the flow variable to use
myValue - the value to assign the flow variable

Responses\:
success - assigned the flow variable

Scriptlet Example\:
[$scriptletContext putGlobal\: $keyName, $myValue];
flow.name: Operating System Health Check

staticBinding.value: The execution has ended successfully. Details about the health check can be found in the report generated at ${reportLocation}
The execution has ended successfully. The generation of the report failed
Performing detection of the OS and running the Health Check
